class SessionManager: 
 19class SessionManager:
 20    def __init__(self, db_session: Session):
 21        self.db_session = DbSession()
 22
 23    def create_new_session(self,user_id=None , expire_after:int = 24):
 24        """Creates a new session and ensures a cart is linked to it."""
 25       
 26        new_token = SessionManager.generate_token()
 27        LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.info("-"*35)
 28        LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.info("Creating new session token..")
 29        with session_scope(commit=True ,raise_exception=True ,logger=LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER) as db_session:
 30           
 31            new_cart = Cart(user_id=user_id ,session_tkn = new_token)
 32
 33            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"Cart created succesfully {new_cart}")
 34            db_session.add(new_cart)
 35            db_session.commit()
 36            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"added cart succesfully {new_cart} ")
 37
 38            new_session = SessionTracking(
 39                token=new_token,
 40                expires_at=datetime.now(timezone.utc) + timedelta(hours=expire_after),
 41                cart_id=new_cart.id, 
 42                user_id=user_id,
 43            )
 44            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"Creating new session  {new_session}")
 45            db_session.add(new_session)
 46            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"session added {new_session}")
 47
 48            return new_session.token 
 49
 50    def verify_session_token(self , session_token):
 51
 52        with session_scope() as db_session:
 53            tkn = db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter(SessionTracking.token == session_token).first()
 54            if tkn:
 55                now = datetime.now()
 56                expiry_time = tkn.expires_at
 57                is_expired = now >=expiry_time
 58                if is_expired:
 59                    return False
 60                else:
 61                    return True
 62            else:
 63                return False
 64            
 65
 66    def create_cart(self , user_id, session_tkn):
 67        """Creates a new empty cart and returns its ID."""
 68        new_cart = CartModel(user_id=user_id ,session_tkn=session_tkn)
 69        self.db_session.add(new_cart)
 70        self.db_session.commit()
 71        return new_cart.id
 72
 73    def get_cart(self, session_token):
 74        """Retrieves the cart associated with a session token."""
 75        session = self.db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter_by(token=session_token).first()
 76        if session:
 77            cart = self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(id=session.cart_id).first()
 78            if cart.is_active:
 79                return session.cart_id
 80            else:
 81                cartid = self.create_cart(user_id=cart.user_id , session_tkn=session_token)
 82                session.cart_id = cartid
 83                self.db_session.commit()
 84                return cartid
 85        else:
 86            return None
 87        
 88    def verify_cart_not_Checked_out(self , cart_id):
 89        cart = self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(id = cart_id).first()
 90        return cart.is_active
 91    
 92    def verify_available_stock(self , product_id ,stock):
 93        product = self.db_session.query(ProductModel).where(ProductModel.id == product_id).first()
 94        if product.category in ['Services']:
 95            return True
 96        return product.stock >=stock
 97
 98    def add_to_cart(self, session_token, product_id, quantity=1):
 99        """Adds an item to the user's cart."""
100        cart_id = self.get_cart(session_token)
101      
102        stock_available = self.verify_available_stock(product_id , quantity)
103        if not stock_available:
104            return {"status":"error" ,"reason":"Max stock exceded"}
105     
106        if cart_id:
107            existing_item = self.db_session.query(CartItem).filter_by(cart_id=cart_id, product_id=product_id).first()
108            if existing_item:
109                existing_item.quantity += quantity
110            else:
111                new_item = CartItem(cart_id=cart_id, product_id=product_id, quantity=quantity)
112                self.db_session.add(new_item)
113            self.db_session.commit()
114        return {"status":"added" ,"reason":None}
115
116    def remove_from_cart(self, session_token, product_id):
117        """Removes an item from the user's cart."""
118        cart_id = self.get_cart(session_token)
119        self.db_session.query(CartItem).where(CartItem.cart_id == cart_id , CartItem.product_id == product_id).delete()
120        self.db_session.commit()
121        
122    def clear_cart(self, session_token):
123        """Empties the user's cart."""
124        cart_id = self.get_cart(session_token)
125        if cart_id:
126            self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(cart_id=cart_id).delete()
127            self.db_session.commit()
128    def get_cartitems(self , cart_id):
129        return self.db_session.query(CartItem).filter_by(cart_id =cart_id).all()
130    
131    def get_cart_summary(self, session_token):
132        """Fetches unique cart items, their quantities, and product details for checkout."""
133        cartdid = self.get_cart(session_token=session_token)
134        cartitems = self.get_cartitems(cart_id=cartdid)
135        results = {}
136        totalcost=0
137        for item in cartitems:
138            item_category = item.product.category
139            if item_category not in results:
140                results[item_category] = []
141            itemprice = item.quantity*item.product.final_price
142            itemdata = {"product_id":item.product_id,"name":item.product.name , "quantity":item.quantity , "price":itemprice}
143            results[item_category].append(itemdata)
144
145            totalcost+=itemprice
146        results['TotalCost'] = totalcost
147        return results
148            
149        
150    def update_cart_item(self, cart_id, product_id, new_quantity):
151        """Updates the quantity of a cart item."""
152        cart_item = (
153            self.db_session.query(CartItem)
154            .filter_by(cart_id=cart_id, product_id=product_id)
155            .first()
156        )
157        if cart_item:
158            cart_item.quantity = new_quantity
159            self.db_session.commit()
160
161    def update_cart(self , cart_id , attribute ,new_value):
162        try:
163            cart = self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(id = cart_id).first()
164            if cart:
165                setattr(cart , attribute , new_value)
166                self.db_session.commit()
167                return True
168            return False
169        except Exception as e:
170            self.db_session.rollback()
171            return None
172    
173    def get_geo_data(self, ip_address):
174        """Fetches geo-location data based on IP address."""
175        try:
176            response = requests.get(f"https://ipinfo.io/{ip_address}/json")
177            if response.status_code == 200:
178                data = response.json()
179                return data.get("country"), data.get("region"), data.get("city")
180        except requests.RequestException:
181            return None, None, None
182
183    def update_session_geo_info(self, session_token):
184        """Updates a session with geo-location data."""
185        session = self.db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter_by(token=session_token).first()
186        if session and session.ip_address:
187            country, region, city = self.get_geo_data(session.ip_address)
188            session.country = country
189            session.region = region
190            session.city = city
191            self.db_session.commit()
192
193    def get_phone_from_session_token(self , tkn):
194        session = self.db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter(SessionTracking.token==tkn).first()
195        print("Userid from getting  phpne" , session.user_id)
196        if session.user_id:
197            phone = self.db_session.query(UserProfile).filter(UserProfile.id == session.user_id).first()
198            return phone.phone
199        else:
200            return None
201        
202    def get_order_from_session_tkn(self , session_tkn:str , status='pending'):
203        orders = self.db_session.query(Order).filter(Order.session == session_tkn , Order.status == status ).all()
204        return orders
205        
206    @staticmethod
207    def generate_token():
208        """Generates a unique session token."""
209        return str(uuid.uuid4()) 
210    @staticmethod
211    def get_ip_address(request):
212        """Retrieves the user's IP address."""
213        return request.headers.get("X-Forwarded-For", request.remote_addr)
214    @staticmethod
215    def get_userid_associated_with_tkn(db_session :Session, session_token):
216        session = db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter_by(token=session_token).first()

def create_new_session(self, user_id=None, expire_after: int = 24): 
23    def create_new_session(self,user_id=None , expire_after:int = 24):
24        """Creates a new session and ensures a cart is linked to it."""
25       
26        new_token = SessionManager.generate_token()
27        LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.info("-"*35)

29        with session_scope(commit=True ,raise_exception=True ,logger=LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER) as db_session:
30

34            db_session.add(new_cart)
35            db_session.commit()
36            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"added cart succesfully {new_cart} ")
37
38            new_session = SessionTracking(
39                token=new_token,
40                expires_at=datetime.now(timezone.utc) + timedelta(hours=expire_after),
41                cart_id=new_cart.id, 
42                user_id=user_id,
43            )
44            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"Creating new session  {new_session}")
45            db_session.add(new_session)
46            LOG.SESSIONS_LOGGER.debug(f"session added {new_session}")
47
48            return new_session.token

def verify_session_token(self, session_token): 
50    def verify_session_token(self , session_token):
51
52        with session_scope() as db_session:
53            tkn = db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter(SessionTracking.token == session_token).first()
54            if tkn:
55                now = datetime.now()
56                expiry_time = tkn.expires_at
57                is_expired = now >=expiry_time
58                if is_expired:
59                    return False
60                else:
61                    return True
62            else:
63                return False

def get_cart(self, session_token): 
73    def get_cart(self, session_token):
74        """Retrieves the cart associated with a session token."""
75        session = self.db_session.query(SessionTracking).filter_by(token=session_token).first()
76        if session:
77            cart = self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(id=session.cart_id).first()
78            if cart.is_active:
79                return session.cart_id
80            else:
81                cartid = self.create_cart(user_id=cart.user_id , session_tkn=session_token)
82                session.cart_id = cartid
83                self.db_session.commit()
84                return cartid
85        else:
86            return None

Retrieves the cart associated with a session token.

def add_to_cart(self, session_token, product_id, quantity=1): 
 98    def add_to_cart(self, session_token, product_id, quantity=1):
 99        """Adds an item to the user's cart."""
100        cart_id = self.get_cart(session_token)
101      
102        stock_available = self.verify_available_stock(product_id , quantity)
103        if not stock_available:
104            return {"status":"error" ,"reason":"Max stock exceded"}
105     
106        if cart_id:
107            existing_item = self.db_session.query(CartItem).filter_by(cart_id=cart_id, product_id=product_id).first()
108            if existing_item:
109                existing_item.quantity += quantity
110            else:
111                new_item = CartItem(cart_id=cart_id, product_id=product_id, quantity=quantity)
112                self.db_session.add(new_item)
113            self.db_session.commit()
114        return {"status":"added" ,"reason":None}

Adds an item to the user's cart.

def get_cart_summary(self, session_token): 
131    def get_cart_summary(self, session_token):
132        """Fetches unique cart items, their quantities, and product details for checkout."""
133        cartdid = self.get_cart(session_token=session_token)
134        cartitems = self.get_cartitems(cart_id=cartdid)
135        results = {}
136        totalcost=0
137        for item in cartitems:
138            item_category = item.product.category
139            if item_category not in results:
140                results[item_category] = []
141            itemprice = item.quantity*item.product.final_price
142            itemdata = {"product_id":item.product_id,"name":item.product.name , "quantity":item.quantity , "price":itemprice}
143            results[item_category].append(itemdata)
144
145            totalcost+=itemprice
146        results['TotalCost'] = totalcost
147        return results

Fetches unique cart items, their quantities, and product details for checkout.

def update_cart(self, cart_id, attribute, new_value): 
161    def update_cart(self , cart_id , attribute ,new_value):
162        try:
163            cart = self.db_session.query(CartModel).filter_by(id = cart_id).first()
164            if cart:
165                setattr(cart , attribute , new_value)
166                self.db_session.commit()
167                return True
168            return False
169        except Exception as e:
170            self.db_session.rollback()
171            return None
def get_geo_data(self, ip_address): 
173    def get_geo_data(self, ip_address):
174        """Fetches geo-location data based on IP address."""
175        try:
176            response = requests.get(f"https://ipinfo.io/{ip_address}/json")
177            if response.status_code == 200:
178                data = response.json()
179                return data.get("country"), data.get("region"), data.get("city")
180        except requests.RequestException:
181            return None, None, None

Fetches geo-location data based on IP address.

187            country, region, city = self.get_geo_data(session.ip_address)

189            session.region = region
190            session.city = city
191            self.db_session.commit()

class VendorTransactionSystem: 
 17class VendorTransactionSystem:
 18    """Handles vendor transactions and dashboard reporting"""
 19
 20    # ======================
 21    # Dashboard Methods
 22    # ======================
 23
 24    @staticmethod
 25    def get_product_stats(vendor_id: int, db_session: Session, threshold: int = 10) -> dict:
 26        """Get inventory statistics with FIXED case-when syntax"""
 27        total, out_of_stock = db_session.query(
 28            func.count(ProductModel.id),
 29            func.sum(
 30                case(
 31                    (ProductModel.stock == 0, 1),  # When stock=0, count as 1
 32                    else_=0                         # Else count as 0
 33                )
 34            )
 35        ).filter(ProductModel.vendor_id == vendor_id).first()
 36
 37        return {
 38            "total_products": total or 0,
 39            "out_of_stock": out_of_stock or 0,
 40            "active_products": (total or 0) - (out_of_stock or 0)
 41        }
 42
 43    @staticmethod #done
 44    def get_revenue_stats(vendor_id: int, db_session: Session, days: int = 7,status ='paid') -> dict:
 45        """Get revenue data including daily breakdown"""
 46        date_range = [(datetime.now() - timedelta(days=i)).date() for i in range(days)]
 47    
 48        revenue_results = db_session.query(
 49           (OrderModel.created_at).label('date'),
 50            func.sum(OrderItem.price_at_purchase * OrderItem.quantity).label('amount')
 51        ).join(VendorOrder, VendorOrder.orderid == OrderModel.id
 52        ).join(OrderItem, VendorOrder.orderitem == OrderItem.id
 53        ).filter(
 54            VendorOrder.vendorid == vendor_id,
 55            OrderModel.created_at >= min(date_range),
 56            OrderModel.status  ==status,
 57        ).group_by(func.date(OrderModel.created_at)).all()
 58    
 59        revenue_by_date = {r.date.strftime("%m-%d"): float(r.amount) for r in revenue_results}
 60        return {
 61            "dates": [d.strftime('%m-%d') for d in date_range],
 62            "amounts": [revenue_by_date.get(d.strftime("%m-%d"),0.0)for d in date_range],
 63            "total": sum(revenue_by_date.values()),
 64            "today": revenue_by_date.get(datetime.now().date().strftime("%m-%d"), 0.0)
 65        }
 66
 67    @staticmethod #done
 68    def calculate_total_revenue(db_session, vendor_id ,status = "paid"):
 69        revenue_per_product = (
 70            db_session.query(
 71                    ProductModel.name,
 72                    func.sum(OrderItem.quantity * ProductModel.price).label("amount")
 73                )
 74                .join(ProductModel, ProductModel.id == OrderItem.product_id)
 75                .join(OrderModel, OrderModel.id == OrderItem.order_id)
 76                .filter(
 77                    ProductModel.vendor_id == vendor_id,
 78                    OrderModel.status == status
 79                )
 80                .group_by(ProductModel.name)
 81                .all()
 82            )
 83        results = {product :amount  for product , amount in revenue_per_product}
 84        total_revenue = sum(results.values())
 85        return {"account_balance":total_revenue , "revenue_per_product":total_revenue}
 86    
 87    @staticmethod # done 
 88    def get_recent_orders(vendor_id: int, db_session: Session, limit: int = 3) -> list:
 89        """Get recent orders with simplified query"""
 90        query= db_session.query(
 91            OrderModel,
 92            func.sum(OrderItem.price_at_purchase * OrderItem.quantity).label('total')
 93        ).join(VendorOrder, VendorOrder.orderid == OrderModel.id
 94        ).join(OrderItem, VendorOrder.orderitem == OrderItem.id
 95        ).filter(VendorOrder.vendorid == vendor_id
 96        ).group_by(OrderModel.id
 97        ).order_by(OrderModel.created_at.desc()
 98        )
 99
100        if limit:
101            return query.limit(limit).all()
102        return query.all()
103    
104    @classmethod
105    def get_format_recent_orders(cls,vendor_id , db_session ,limit:int = 3):
106        
107        return  [{
108            'id': f"ORD-{order.id}",
109            'total': float(total),
110            'status': order.status,
111            'time_ago': humanize.naturaltime(datetime.now() - order.created_at),
112            'customer': f"{order.phone_number[:-2]}.."
113        } for order, total in cls.get_recent_orders(vendor_id, db_session ,limit)]
114
115
116    @staticmethod #done
117    def get_low_stock_items(vendor_id: int, db_session: Session, threshold: int = 10) -> list:
118        """Get products below stock threshold"""
119        return db_session.query(ProductModel).filter(
120            ProductModel.vendor_id == vendor_id,
121            ProductModel.stock < threshold
122        ).order_by(ProductModel.stock.asc()).all()
123
124    @classmethod  # done
125    def get_vendor_dashboard(cls, vendor_id: int, db_session: Session , 
126                             status = 'paid',stock_threshold=10 ,limit :int=3) -> dict:
127        """Assemble complete dashboard data"""
128        dashboard = {}
129            
130        # 1. Product statistics
131        dashboard.update(cls.get_product_stats(vendor_id, db_session))
132        dashboard.update(cls.calculate_total_revenue(db_session , vendor_id ,status = status))
133
134        # 2. Revenue data
135        revenue = cls.get_revenue_stats(vendor_id, db_session ,status = status)
136        dashboard.update({
137            'total_revenue': revenue['total'],
138            'daily_revenue': {
139                'dates': revenue['dates'],
140                'amounts': revenue['amounts']
141            },
142            'today_revenue': revenue['today']
143        })
144
145        # 3. Recent orders
146        dashboard['recent_orders'] = cls.get_format_recent_orders(
147            vendor_id=vendor_id,
148            db_session=db_session,
149            limit=limit
150        )
151
152        # 4. Low stock items
153        dashboard['low_stock_items'] = [{
154            'id': p.id,
155            'name': p.name,
156            'stock': p.stock,
157            'threshold': stock_threshold
158        } for p in cls.get_low_stock_items(vendor_id, db_session ,threshold=stock_threshold)]
159
160        return dashboard
161
162    @classmethod
163    def get_all_vendor_dashboard(cls ,vendor_id , db_session:Session):
164        results = {}
165        for status in ['paid' ,'pending' ,'cancled']:
166            data = cls.get_vendor_dashboard(vendor_id , db_session ,status)
167            results[status] = data
168        return results
169            
170
171    # ======================
172    # Balance Tracking Methods
173    # ======================
174
175    @staticmethod
176    def update_vendor_balance(vendor_id: int, amount: float, db_session: Session):
177        """Update vendor balance when orders are processed"""
178
179        # Get or create balance record
180        user = db_session.query(UserProfile).filter_by(id=vendor_id).first()
181        if not user:
182            raise Exception("invalid user account.")
183   
184        if not user.balance:
185            balance = UserBalance(id=vendor_id, balance=0)
186
187            db_session.add(balance)
188            db_session.flush()
189
190            user.balance = balance
191
192        user.balance.balance += amount
193        return user.balance
194    
195    @classmethod
196    def update_vendors_accounts(cls,vendor_data:dict):
197        LOG.SHOP_LOGGER.debug(f"[SALES] Updating vendors account with data {vendor_data}")
198        
199        with session_scope() as db_session:
200            for vendor_id , amount in vendor_data.items():
201                balance = cls.update_vendor_balance(vendor_id, amount, db_session)
202
203            db_session.commit()
204

206    @classmethod #done
207    def divide_order_to_vendors(cls, order_id: int):
208        """
209        Distribute payment to vendors for a given order.
210        
211        Args:
212            order_id (int): ID of the order to process.
213            db_session (Session): Active SQLAlchemy session.
214        """
215        with session_scope() as db_session:
216            vendor_shares = db_session.query(
217                VendorOrder.vendorid,
218                func.sum(OrderItem.price_at_purchase * OrderItem.quantity).label('amount')
219            ).join(OrderItem, VendorOrder.orderitem == OrderItem.id
220            ).filter(VendorOrder.orderid == order_id
221            ).group_by(VendorOrder.vendorid).all()
222
223            # Update each vendor's balance
224            vendor_data = {}
225            for vendor_id, amount in vendor_shares:
226                vendor_data[vendor_id]=amount
227            
228            return len(vendor_shares)   ,vendor_data

147            vendor_id=vendor_id,
148            db_session=db_session,
149            limit=limit
150        )
151
152        # 4. Low stock items
153        dashboard['low_stock_items'] = [{
154            'id': p.id,
155            'name': p.name,
156            'stock': p.stock,
157            'threshold': stock_threshold
158        } for p in cls.get_low_stock_items(vendor_id, db_session ,threshold=stock_threshold)]
159
160        return dashboard

@classmethod
def get_all_vendor_dashboard(cls, vendor_id, db_session: sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): 
162    @classmethod
163    def get_all_vendor_dashboard(cls ,vendor_id , db_session:Session):
164        results = {}
165        for status in ['paid' ,'pending' ,'cancled']:
166            data = cls.get_vendor_dashboard(vendor_id , db_session ,status)
167            results[status] = data

@staticmethod
def update_vendor_balance( vendor_id: int, amount: float, db_session: sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session): 
175    @staticmethod
176    def update_vendor_balance(vendor_id: int, amount: float, db_session: Session):
177        """Update vendor balance when orders are processed"""
178
179        # Get or create balance record
180        user = db_session.query(UserProfile).filter_by(id=vendor_id).first()
181        if not user:
182            raise Exception("invalid user account.")
183   
184        if not user.balance:
185            balance = UserBalance(id=vendor_id, balance=0)
186
187            db_session.add(balance)
188            db_session.flush()
189
190            user.balance = balance
191
192        user.balance.balance += amount
193        return user.balance

@classmethod
def divide_order_to_vendors(cls, order_id: int): 
206    @classmethod #done
207    def divide_order_to_vendors(cls, order_id: int):
208        """
209        Distribute payment to vendors for a given order.
210        
211        Args:
212            order_id (int): ID of the order to process.
213            db_session (Session): Active SQLAlchemy session.
214        """
215        with session_scope() as db_session:
216            vendor_shares = db_session.query(
217                VendorOrder.vendorid,
218                func.sum(OrderItem.price_at_purchase * OrderItem.quantity).label('amount')
219            ).join(OrderItem, VendorOrder.orderitem == OrderItem.id
220            ).filter(VendorOrder.orderid == order_id
221            ).group_by(VendorOrder.vendorid).all()
222
223            # Update each vendor's balance
224            vendor_data = {}
225            for vendor_id, amount in vendor_shares:
226                vendor_data[vendor_id]=amount
227            
228            return len(vendor_shares)   ,vendor_data
